name: Sofitel Krabi Phokeethra Golf & Spa Resort

reviews.text: A beautiful property kept in good condition throughout. Large grounds and pool area. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Large clean rooms. A lot of attentive staff wich I like.
reviews.title: Great hotel - but a bit overprices and away from everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: 20 minutes by taxi from Ao Nang, on a quiet beach with a not-so quiet country road in between with ore trucks going in and out to the nearby ore pier. The beach is practically private, but could use some tlc; the beaches in this area have some litter and broken glass but only Sheraton seems to clean its beachfront daily. I'd recommend Sofitel to do the same. Village center, supermarkets and some very nice restaurants are a short walk away, some of them are reachable by the beach. Taxi stop is right by the beach, 20 meters from the hotel. Fare to Ao Nang is 400 baht, can be haggled down to 300. Krabi Town is 500-600 baht and about 35 minutes away.
reviews.title: Great pool, great service, lots of activities
Great hotel and helpful staff
reviews.text: Hotel: Reception area looks fantastic and check-in is very pleasant with with drinks and cold towels while lounging in the shade, no need to get up since you sign in with an ipad. The activity center in the lobby has boards with the daily activities and trips to the region with the hotel speed boats. We compared the pricing with tour operators in the area and our own travel agency and Sofitel is the one of the cheaper ones. And their boat is no longtail.

Room: We had a luxury room with a view to the spa and could see some sea as well. The bathroom was big enough with a tub and a separate shower area. No complaints there, 2 people fit in nicely and there was enough complimentary cosmetics to keep my sunburns moistened. The minibar was expensive (as they always are) and closet space limited (but at 38C wardrobe options are limited anyways). Fresh ice and fruit was delivered to the room every night (very nice). And yes, the wifi should be free, it's 2012.
reviews.title: Not upto our expectations, but we have some good memories too

reviews.text: Grounds: The pool is great. Really. And huge. A bar in the middle and a separate jacuzzi area, infinity pool, kids pool, water polo, bridge with a water fall, sun bathing seats with bubble ports... it's great. We got great service by the pool, a couple of Singhas do wonders in the afternoon heat. Food is expensive but good if you decide to eat by the pool. There are hammocks in the garden, but in the sun so not for my pale face, great to watch the sun set tho.
reviews.title: Great kids' club and pool, can get expensive with children

reviews.text: Activities: The gym is very small and not heavy enough for the serious lifter. But the equipment is good quality (Leoko) and everything works. Sadly I didnt have the time for the complimentary thai boxing lessons. The staff at the gym was very helpful.
reviews.title: Secluded and quiet resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 10 days at this Sofitel and found it to be a mixed experienced, mostly good but with a few flaws which could easily have been rectified and the service levels improved.
reviews.title: Scenic location, some issues with dining and service

reviews.text: Firstly, the good side of the hotel. This must start with the lovely and very large swimming pool set amidst beautiful gardens and manicured lawns. It is a very scenic, relaxing and restful place, with lots of natural shade from palm trees in the gardens. The extensive pool is "infinity" on one side and gives a wonderful swimming area with its warm clean water and plentiful loungers around the side, The pool-staff were very good with towels and quite attentive.
reviews.title: Oh la la!

description: Stunning resort providing traditional Thai hospitality. Close to AoNang, Koh Phi Phi, James Bond islands. 276 Victorian-style rooms & suites with spectacular views. Includes Thailand's largest pool (75,347 sq. ft/7000 m²), private yachts, golf course, tenniscourts, Kids club, Spa and a line-up of restaurants: Pizzeria, White Lotus with Thai & Indian recipes and Poda with pool-side BBQ's rounding off your culinary experience. The indoor and outdoor spaces are ideal for weddings & events.
